Description HTML:
SitelogIQ is a rapidly growing energy and facility services company focused on making buildings better. We provide planning, design, and management solutions for organizations that want efficient and sustainable building environments that are healthier and safer for their occupants.

Our Marketing Research & Demand Generation Analyst will be a SitelogIQ Headquarters employee and can work a hybrid arrangement in close proximity to an office location (Minneapolis, Chicago, Sacramento, or Harrisburg, PA). As a Marketing Research & Demand Generation Analyst, your data sleuthing ability and keen campaign insight and analysis, as well as presentation skills will make you an instrumental team member. in support of go-to-market strategy implementation. You’ll provide crucial intelligence for our marketing and sales teams as part of our go-to-marketing strategies.

As a contributing team member of a high-performing team, we’re looking for a real go-getter; someone who can use their technical skills and analytical expertise to deliver immediate value and help drive positive outcomes. The successful candidate must be excited to learn about SitelogIQ and our industry and make the important connection between strategy and execution.

Marketing Research & Demand Generation Analyst Responsibilities:

  • Conduct deep market research, analyze insights, and distill key company and leadership intel into concise reports for sales and marketing team use, through data mining and scientific investigation.
  • Develop vertical-specific lead contact lists and help to personalize messaging through copywriting.
  • Develop vertical and market specific call/cold email messages and facilitate campaign A/B testing.
  • Responsible for tracking, analyzing, and reporting of demand generation outreach performance and success, and present to sales and marketing teams.
  • Act as the marketing front person to sales and product marketing teams to support collaborative lead nurturing and business development efforts.
  • Understand and take an active role in improving marketing strategy and campaign practices, mining for emerging trends, efficiencies, and automations that advance our campaign efforts and ensure the messages are delivered accurately and properly to current and prospective customers.
  • Be a campaign connoisseur and collaborate with marketing team members to develop and implement effective email drip campaign sequences. You’ll need to build and maintain strong relationships throughout our organization.

Marketing Research & Demand Generation Analyst Qualifications:

  • Associate or Bachelor’s degree in Marketing or Communications
  • 2+ years of experience; experience in a B2B SaaS support role a plus.
  • Strong computer, scientific, analytical, and organizational skills.
  • Keen relationship builder.
  • Informed on market trends and how to build and maintain a competitive landscape.
  • Detail orientated with excellent oral and written communication skills.
  • Self-motivated, adaptable, collaborative, curious, and has a positive attitude.
  • Comfortable serving in a liaison and advocate role; and interacting with varying levels of stakeholders.
  • Must be able to quickly learn new techniques, juggle multiple projects and deadlines, keep accurate records, and communicate effectively.
  • Experience with ZoomInfo a plus.

No agencies please

Benefits

We offer a highly competitive salary, and comprehensive benefits, including:

  • Medical, dental, and vision insurance
  • Disability and life insurance
  • 401K
  • Flex time off
  • 12 paid holidays
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Opportunities to drive our DE&I efforts by joining our affinity groups, Veterans and Allies Leadership Organization or Women Inspiring & Strengthening Everyone
  • Opportunities to give back to our local communities through organized events or fundraisers

More About SitelogIQ

At SitelogIQ, we’re focused on creating a great environment for our team first so that it is more energizing and rewarding to focus on creating a great customer experience. That’s what we call a win-win.

We partner with clients in K-12, higher ed, government, healthcare, multifamily housing, and industry to optimize energy efficiency, improve indoor air quality, address lighting, and improve the customer experience. With offices across the country, it’s rewarding to make a difference in the communities where our teammates live and work.

Title: Market Research Analyst II
Description:
IGT (NYSE:IGT) is a global leader in gaming. We deliver entertaining and responsible gaming experiences for players across all channels and regulated segments, from Lotteries and Gaming Machines to Sports Betting and Digital. Leveraging a wealth of compelling content, substantial investment in innovation, player insights, operational expertise, and leading-edge technology, our solutions deliver unrivaled gaming experiences that engage players and drive growth. We have a well-established local presence and relationships with governments and regulators in more than 100 countries around the world, and create value by adhering to the highest standards of service, integrity, and responsibility. IGT has approximately 10,500 employees. For more information, please visit www.igt.com.

Overview

Be part of a progressive market research team with a leader in the casino gaming industry. IGT is looking for an energetic and outgoing market research professional to help conduct research projects on casino games, markets, and customers.

The Market Research Analyst will work with the market research team to run an efficient program which keeps both the budget and the company’s overall goals in mind. They will be responsible for ensuring that each project yields actionable results which will be used to inform product decisions at all levels of the organization.

Specific tasks and responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:

 Overall design of project specifications and methodologies for qualitative and quantitative market research projects, including creation of project-specific materials such as market research briefs, surveys, and fielding plans Programming of online surveys Conduct in-field interviews with players and customers Design, coordinate, and execute all phases of market research projects, including logistics, fielding, analysis, and creation of deliverables Production of intelligible and comprehensive analytical reports Ensure transparent, consistent communications with internal stakeholder teams and external partners

Work Location:

This is a hybrid position based in our Las Vegas, Nevada office (onsite 2-3 days per week).

Requirements

Minimum Qualifications:

 2+ years’ experience in commercial or academic research (design and execution) Proficiency with Microsoft office applications (PowerPoint, Excel, and Word) Outstanding verbal and written communications skills Excellent analytical and strategic thinking skills Strong organizational and time management/prioritization skills Ability to multi-task while maintaining strong attention to detail Highly motivated, collaborative attitude Able to work across business verticals in a collaborative, cross-functional manner Ability to travel to fieldwork locations (local, domestic, and international) Ability to work flexible hours, including some evenings Bachelor’s degree in Social Sciences, Human Factors, Statistics, Research Methodologies, or similar

Preferred Qualifications

 Experience in the casino gaming industry Hands-on experience moderating in-depth interviews, focus groups, and similar Successful completion of a professional moderator training program (Riva, Burke, etc.) Ability to type verbatim notes in real-time Data analysis experience (either SPSS or Excel) Survey writing and fielding experience Online survey programming experience: Qualtrics, Survey Monkey, etc.)

Who You Are

 Motivated self-starter who is passionate about growing their market research career Confident in providing input and sharing ideas with the team Team player who is comfortable wearing different hats and working with people at all levels of business from diverse backgrounds

Keys to Success

 Building collaborative relationships Decision making Drive results Foster innovation Personal energy Self-leadership

IGT is committed to sustaining a workforce that reflects the diversity of the global customers and communities we serve, creating a fair and inclusive culture that enables all our employees to feel valued, respected and engaged. IGT is an equal opportunity employer. We provide equal opportunities without regard to sex, race, color, religion, age, national origin or ancestry, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic information, gender identity or expression, and any other personal attributes protected by federal, state, or other laws. We thank all applicants for applying; however, only those selected to interview will be contacted.

At IGT, we consider a wide range of factors in determining compensation, including background, skills, experience, and work location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary. The estimated starting compensation range is $50,000-$101,000. The actual pay offered may end up being higher or lower. The Company will comply with all local pay requirements and collective bargaining agreements, where applicable.

Base pay is only one part of our Total Rewards program. Sales roles may be eligible for commission payments, while other roles are eligible for discretionary bonuses. Position Summary

Reporting to the Senior Director, Strategy, Research, and Performance, the Marketing Performance Analyst serves as a key architect in transforming our marketing and communications strategies into quantifiable success stories. This position is responsible for spearheading the analysis and interpretation of intricate data sets to extract meaningful insights, guiding our marketing endeavors with a keen emphasis on measurable impact.

Essential Functions

Designs and implements comprehensive strategy to track marketing performance metrics and key performance indicators (KPIs), evaluating the effectiveness of Fordham’s marketing and communication initiatives.

Conducts in-depth data analysis of marketing campaigns, website traffic, email marketing, social media engagement, and other relevant channels to identify trends, patterns, and areas for optimization.

Collaborates with cross-functional teams to provide actionable insights and recommendations for enhancing marketing strategies based on data analysis.

Leads efforts in implementing testing methodologies, including A/B testing, to optimize marketing strategies and improve campaign performance.

Utilizes data visualization tools to effectively communicate complex data insights to both technical and non-technical audiences.

Develops and delivers regular reports and intuitive dashboards that communicate key performance metrics and impact to senior leadership and stakeholders.

Champions a data-driven culture within the University Marketing and Communications division and across the University, ensuring the integration of analytics into decision-making processes.

Works closely with marketing teams to define and refine campaign objectives, ensuring they align with institutional goals and priorities.

Collaborates with Fordham IT on critical data and infrastructure projects that support marketing and communications, while establishing strong partnerships with external vendors or agencies as needed to enhance data collection, analysis, and reporting capabilities.

Minimum of 3 years of experience in marketing analytics or a similar analytical role.

Proficiency in data analysis tools and platforms, such as Google Analytics, Tableau, Power BI, or similar.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to derive actionable insights from complex data sets.

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present data-driven insights to diverse stakeholders.

Must be comfortable working in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment.

Preferred Qualifications

Master’s degree in marketing, business analytics, statistics, or a related field.

Demonstrated success in crisis communication management on social media platforms.

Additionally, you will be part of a global team with opportunities to support our customers and team members internationally. If you are a highly motivated and driven individual who is internet savvy and seeking a career working with cutting edge technology and global branding, this could be the perfect opportunity for you.

 Providing strategic advice to customers to help build a comprehensive brand protection strategy Cooperatively work with global teams and customers to ensure alignment with customers’ acquisition or recovery and enforcement strategy Proactively anticipate client concerns and provide solutions Conduct background investigations, research, and analysis around trademark infringement and brand abuse Analyze the content of websites to identify infringing content Draft complaints related to domain names (UDRP, DRP & URS) Overall case management of enforcement work in progress Coordinate with internal teams to transfer in domain names that have been acquired/recovered Ability to be a self-starter and work in a fast paced environment

The analyst we’re looking for knows that data is important, but it's the deep analysis and curation of the full story that are most critical.  Bachelor’s degree with business, math, statistics, or related discipline 8-10 years of sales / marketing data engineering, analysis, and reporting experience Technical expertise in building and translating sales and marketing analytics, including reporting on pipeline health, forecasting, sales effectiveness, and data-quality metrics. As a Senior Associate Market Researcher at Capital One, you will apply your strategic and research skills to major company challenges. Our Retail Banking business is on an audacious mission to grow a national bank – via compelling new products, competitive pricing, and groundbreaking market strategies. As we continue to build our national banking brand, we’ve committed to keeping our customers (existing and future) at the center of our strategy. Our Market Research team is critical to helping teams across the Bank understand the broader banking landscape and what drives customer behaviors and perceptions as they relate to banking.

Our Market Research team is looking for a talented Researcher to help shape our learning agenda for Market Research and advise on strategies across the Bank. Are you excited about bringing customers’ voices to the table? Are you interested in partnering with a large variety of teams across an organization to drive decision-making? Do you crave white space and the opportunity to create and execute on research that will help shape long-term strategy? Are you looking forward to partnering with a team of talented researchers and analysts to uncover insights that will impact large-scale initiatives? If so, read on!

 Strategic Leadership: Develop, execute, and share research that will promote customer-centricity and drive competitive success for Capital One in the face of shifting consumer and regulatory demands.  Partnership and Teamwork : Partner with a diverse team of subject matter experts from across the Bank to create results that meaningfully impact our long-term strategy.  Research Orientation: A proven track record of market research. Conceptual thinking skills and a thirst for open-ended questions must be complemented by a strong quantitative orientation.  Execution : Manage and sequence delivery of business initiatives, build business requirements, and execute against our market research agenda. Work on multiple projects concurrently. Partner with and manage vendors as they execute research studies. Draft research reports, including developing data charts, graphs, and presentations.  Influence: Build and leverage the capabilities of a high-performing team, as well as business partners across the enterprise. Researchers should foster innovation, drive critical decisions, and consistently deliver results, including synthesizing key findings across multiple, interdisciplinary sources, culminating in research-backed business recommendations.  Strong Executive Communication & Storytelling Skills: Impeccable written and oral communication credentials, coupled with strategic influencing skills and the ability to drive agreement through intellect, interpersonal and negotiation skills. Ability to effectively summarize analysis for an executive audience is essential.  Clear Results Orientation: Display an intense focus on achieving both short- and long-term goals. Research should be able to drive and execute an agenda in an uncertain and fluid environment.  Growth Mindset: Embrace challenge, be curious, and actively seek to learn.  Successful track record of thriving in a fast paced, entrepreneurial and dynamic environment.

 Bachelor's Degree or military experience  At least 2 years of experience in market research or behavioral-based research executing both qualitative and quantitative methodologies  At least 1 year of experience working with quantitative research vendors 

Preferred Qualifications:

 Masters Degree in Marketing, Market Research, Statistics, Behavioral Sciences, or Consumer Psychology  3+ years of experience in Market or Product Development research  2+ years of experience analyzing and interpreting large data sets into insights to inform business strategies

You can create experiences–from payments to rewards to servicing–that keep us connected to our customers and serve them at every touchpoint. Find your place in product on #TeamAmex.

The successful candidate will be an energetic, intellectually curious, customer-first analytical thinker with strong project management skills, clear communication, and have a strong attention to detail.
